org.usfirst.frc.team5940.motorcontrol.groups

Interface MotorGroup

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CANTalonShiftingGroup, CANTalonSimpleGroup, CANTalonSpeedyGroup, VictorGroup, VictorSimpleGroup

    public interface MotorGroup

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canMeasureSpeed()
      Returns if this motor group has speed measurement.
      boolean getEnabled()
      Gets whether this MotorGroup is enabled.
      int getGear()
      Gets the gear of the motor.
      int getGearsAmount()
      Returns the number of gears this MotorGroup has.
      boolean getInverted() 
      java.lang.String getName()
      This should return the name of the MotorGroup.
      float getSetValue()
      This should return the value corresponding to the last setValue.
      float getSpeed()
      Returns the speed in rpm of the motor shafts, undefined if canMeasureSpeed is false or null.
      void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets whether or not this MotorGroup is enabled.
      void setGear(int gear)
      Sets the gear of the MotorGroup.
      void setInverted(boolean inverted)
      This tells the motors whether or not to be inverted
      void setValue(float value)
      Sets the value of output for the motors.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        This should return the name of the MotorGroup. This should only be used for human identification purposes, not in code. If no name has been set (for instance through a constructor) it should return the name of its class file.
        Returns:
        A String representing the name of the MotorGroup.

      • setValue

        void setValue(float value)
        Sets the value of output for the motors. -1 should represent full speed backwards, 0 should represent completely stopped, 1 should represent full speed forward. Any non linearity or other control systems (voltage based, PID, PWM, etc...) are up to the implementation, as long as they follow those guidelines. TODO: Rename this method! Perhaps setOutput() ?
        Parameters:
        value - A float between -1 an 1.

      • getSetValue

        float getSetValue()
        This should return the value corresponding to the last setValue. If the MotorGroup is disabled, it should still return the value that will resume being used when re-enabled.
        Returns:
        The float the MotorGroup is set to.

      • getSpeed

        float getSpeed()
        Returns the speed in rpm of the motor shafts, undefined if canMeasureSpeed is false or null.
        Returns:
        A float representing the speed of the motor group in rpm

      • canMeasureSpeed

        boolean canMeasureSpeed()
        Returns if this motor group has speed measurement.
        Returns:
        boolean, see above.

      • getGearsAmount

        int getGearsAmount()
        Returns the number of gears this MotorGroup has. This should be a number between 1 and infinity as you always have one gear.
        Returns:
        An int representing the number of gearing positions this motor group can be in.

      • getGear

        int getGear()
        Gets the gear of the motor. This should update immediately with new gears from setGear, if shifting fails, etc.. it should update back to it's actual state.
        Returns:
        An int representing the current gear of the motor group.

      • setGear

        void setGear(int gear)
        Sets the gear of the MotorGroup. This starts from 0 as the highest torque/ lowest speed, up to getGearsAmount() -1.
        Parameters:
        gear - Sets the gear of this MotorGroup.

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether or not this MotorGroup is enabled.
        Parameters:
        enabled - A boolean representing enabledness.

      • getEnabled

        boolean getEnabled()
        Gets whether this MotorGroup is enabled.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing enabledness.

      • setInverted

        void setInverted(boolean inverted)
        This tells the motors whether or not to be inverted
        Parameters:
        inverted - whether or not

      • getInverted

        boolean getInverted()
